wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Sir Douglas Glover,  (13 February 1908 – 15 January 1982) was a Conservative Party politician in the United Kingdom who served as Member of Parliament for Ormskirk, in Lancashire, from 1953 until 1970, and was a colonel in the Army during World War II. Sometime Chairman of the Conservative Party, and of the British Anti-Slavery Society.

response: * Colonel Douglas Glover, , Member of Parliament for Ormskirk since 1953. For political and public services in North-West England.
